intro: Godetia bottae var. cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical seed pods. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. The leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its distinctive botanical profile.
